tenses.name: Present Simple
examples: I work from home.
She drinks coffee every morning.
The sun rises in the east.

tenses.name: Present Continuous
tenses.use: Actions happening now or temporary actions
examples: I am studying for my exam.
They are watching a movie.
She is staying with a friend this week.

tenses.name: Present Perfect
tenses.use: Past actions connected to now, life experiences
examples: I have visited Paris.
She has lost her keys.
We have known each other for years.

tenses.name: Present Perfect Continuous
tenses.use: Actions started in the past and still continuing or just stopped
examples: I have been reading for two hours.
He has been working all day.
We have been waiting since 3 PM.

tenses.name: Past Simple
tenses.use: Finished actions in the past at a specific time
examples: I visited Rome last summer.
She bought a new phone yesterday.
We watched that movie last night.

tenses.name: Past Continuous
tenses.use: Past actions in progress or interrupted
examples: I was watching TV when she called.
They were studying all evening.
It was raining at 7 PM.

tenses.name: Past Perfect
tenses.use: Actions that happened before another past action
examples: I had finished dinner before he arrived.
She had already left when I called.
They had studied English before moving to London.

tenses.name: Past Perfect Continuous
tenses.use: Long actions before another past event
examples: I had been working all day before I rested.
They had been driving for hours when they stopped.
She had been crying, so her eyes were red.

tenses.name: Future Simple
examples: I will help you with that.
She will probably come later.
It will be fine.

tenses.name: Be Going To
tenses.use: Plans, intentions, predictions based on now
examples: I am going to travel to Spain.
It is going to rain.
We are going to study together.

tenses.name: Future Continuous
tenses.use: Actions in progress at a specific future time
examples: I will be flying to Canada tomorrow.
She will be working late tonight.
They will be sleeping at midnight.

tenses.name: Future Perfect
tenses.use: Actions finished before a certain future time
examples: I will have graduated by next year.
She will have finished the book by Friday.
They will have arrived before noon.
